comm: what a start that is. Short and wide, the worst possible delivery to this guy. Warner laces the cut through point, with timing I didn't see too much in round 1
another full outswinger, 147ks, encouraging carry to Wade, a far cry from the low bounce at the Providence. Ignored by the batsman again
yorker, nudging 140ks, homing in on the off stump, squeezed out
nicely bowled again. Just outside off - fifth-stump line and Warner defends again
shapes this one away and starts it off on middle so that it goes to off. Warner blocks. Nice comeback

poor delivery. So two bad deliveries gives Australia the start they wanted. Short and wide and Warner climbs all over it, thrashes a cut past point again, to the other side, more towards backward point
full and wide outside off, Finch comes forward and leaves. Just a bit of away movement
overstepped. Can't do that KG. Back of a length outside off and Finch defends into the off side
smears it to the midwicket boundary. Not a bad delivery actually, fullish on leg. Finch backs away and mis-times his lofted drive, all along the ground, through midwicket
nice. Back of a length, swerves back in from outside off. Left alone
nicely bowled. Attacking Finch's pads, but he is good enough to push to mid-on for a quick single. Good run
back of a length on off,Warner blocks into the off side. Good, nagging lines
superb stop. A boundary-saving dive from Parnell. Saved four in fact. Awesome. Short and wide from Rabada, and Warner cuts towards cover point where Parnell dives to his left and stops it
a good length outside off, left alone. Finch showing some patience, could be a plan
fullish on a fifth-stump line. Finch defends nicely
hmm, shortish and wide outside off. Finch cuts but times it so badly that it doesn't leave the pitch.
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover from the crease. Abbott's lines are good so far to Finch
nice again. A good length outside off, and Finch leaves. Not bowling it too full
keeps it outside off, Finch lunges forward to punch into the off side. So tight that over was, maiden.

ooh, a bit of a sloppy misfield and four. Shortish and wide, didn't get the impression that he timed that too well. the cut went more towards cover where a bobble just in front of the fielder helps it take it past him
back of a length on middle, dead-bat defense
shortish and wide again, but not as wide. Warner chops a cut to cover point, dot ball
full, maybe for the first time at that length. Warner stays back and pushes to mid-off. Not much movement for the SA bowlers
wow, gone all the way. Shortish on off, Warner pulls. So effortless, so lazy. Made sure he got his pull over square leg and even though he had to drag it from off, it goes well over.
good single. Fullish on off, tip and run to cover. Great
nagging away at that off bail. Warner stays in his crease to tap to point.
slightly straight-ish and Warner works the ball off his hips towards square leg
good stuff. Good length on middle, pushed to mid-on. Warner isn't moving his feet too much
this time he takes it off his pads and works to fine leg
another sloppy misfield from Phangiso at cover. Punched to him from the back foot and he parries it towards mid-off. These two make the run easily
keeps it on a good length on off, not much even Warner can do about that. Defends to point. Splendid over
fullish outside off, Finch presses forward and defends
back of a length on middle, jags back enough to take the ball past Finch's inside edge. Smashes into his thigh pad
looking for that yorker. 149.5 kph. A full toss, Finch inside-edges into his pad. Rabada appeals vociferously but clearly a lot of bat
full and wide outside off, steered to third man for a run. Good from Finch, taking himself off strike
speared in the blockhole again. 150.2 kph. Yikes, that's quick. Warner jams it out.

may have been out with a direct hit. Warner pushes a good length delivery towards short cover and calls for one. Rabada runs to the ball as the crow flies. As a result, Finch has to deviate off course slightly. rabada misses the stumps though at the batsman's end
nowhere near the middle but four more. Shortish on Warner's pads and Warner is through his swivel-pull too early. Goes to midwicket instead of behind square. Four
fullish on off, defended
a bit too straight and clipped to square leg. Hurried for pace again
tapped to point. Good length again, good bowling
back of a length on middle and leg. Defended again, great bowling. Keeping Warner quiet
too straight and easily nudged to fine leg for a run. Slightly erring in line, but intentionally not offering width
short and wide, smashed. Through point, four more. Not the right line. Warner stands tall and cuts it with ease
keeps it tight on off. Nice line. Warner is forced to defend after looking to clip through the leg side
shortish and wide, dabbed to third man after getting on top of the bounce. Good batting. Got it over the infield
full on off, Finch pushes to mid-off from the crease
Rabada oversteps again. Not very good from him. Overly full outside off, Finch punches into the off side, where there is another parry to mid-off from cover
shortish on off, Finch clears one foot, looks to smear over midwicket but is hurried for pace. As a result, the ball takes the top edge and flies over the keeper for four
Finch opens the bat-face to guide to third man. Really clever batting
overpitched outside off, drilled to mid-off
fullish and wide outside off, good stuff. Finch leaves
tight on off, full length. Pushed to cover
good length on off, Finch turns the ball to midwicket
132 kph, but very close to off on a good length. Finch defends
maiden. Good bowling from Abbott. Back of a length outside off, punched to cover
shortish on off, Warner goes back and cuts powerfully to deep point
tossed up on middle, Finch prods forward and inside-edges to midwicket
the googly. Turns away from Warner, right into his cut. Straight to point
shortish again outside off, steered to third man
flat, very quick. 96 kph, punched to deep cover

gone. Finch persists with the sweep. Flat on off, the quicker delivery. Finch clears a front foot and tries to smash his sweep through square leg but was quite far from the ball. The ball missed his cross-batted swat and clattered into off stump. Tahir sets off in typical fashion. Finch struggled for any fluency in that knock.
good length and straight, turned to square leg
too straight to Khawaja who flicks one off his hips to fine leg
pushed to mid-on from the crease
full on off, pushed to Parnell from the crease. Good length, looking for some swing but there is none there
shortish and wide, a poor ball. Warner finds point with his cut
too short again, Warner finds the gap through point this time for a run to the sweeper cover
smashed for six. Easy does it. Tossed up on off, Warner clears his front foot and then smashes the ball straight past the bowler. Whacks the sightscreen. Shot.
flatter on off, pulls his length back there. Defended nicely
the googly outside off and Warner cuts to deep point. Great batting
some flight on off, much more confident against Khawaja than Warner is Tahir. Punched in the air to long-off
full toss on middle, skewed to midwicket
more flight outside off, thrashed down to long-off for a run.
tucked off his hips to square leg
shortish outside off, chopped into the surface, towards point
close with a direct hit. Clipped from a full length to mid-on and Khawaja labours through to the other end. His bat jammed into Parnell's foot and lobbed up but he made it easily
slower ball on leg, pushed to mid-on
nice line. Nags away on off, chopped to cover.
a good over. Just three singles off it. Back of a length on middle, Warner stays in his crease and turns the ball to square leg to get one
flat on middle and leg to start, Warner punches to long-on from the back foot. Using the depth of the crease well
ooh, a bit of spin. Slow and short, and wide, slapped to deep cover
drifts down leg, turned to midwicket for an easy single
another easy push to midwicket for a single. Good flight from Duminy
slower and straighter, tighter. Warner defends from the crease
short and wide, smashed past cover for a couple. Good dive from the fielder at long-off to stop the boundary
shortish outside off, chopped to the keeper. Khawaja trying to open the face to guide to third man but didn't get that
clipped off past square leg for a couple this time. Again, too straight from Parnell in the aim of attacking the stumps
short and wide, Khawaja should have done more with that. Tried to cut but the ball went through
dabbed to third man off the open face
fifty for Warner. What form he is in. Slaps a short delivery to deep cover. Continues to churn out the runs. Quality innings, but a lot to be done
fullish on off, pushed back to the bowler
flight on off, Warner pushes towards point
tossed up on off, punched to cover
four. Easy. Too short from JP. Warner goes back and pulls in the gap behind square. Too easy. Poor ball
tossed up on middle and leg, squirted to midwicket
blocked from the front foot
short and wide, scythed to deep point for one
yorker, swerving in wickedly on leg, Warner jabs his bat down on it
shorter and outside off, stops on Warner. He leaps and flat-bat swats it to point
short incoming ball on off, Warner hops and turns it neatly through square leg. Warner scampers back for the second. Sharp running
short, angled in, tucked off the hips to long leg
Khawaja presses forward and across as he dabs this cutter towards midwicket
Warner pulls pace off it, another cutter, sticks in the surface and kicks up at Khawaja. He fends it with soft hands
and Warner welcomes the spinner with a reverse-swept four. Full enough outside off, Warner stretches forward and middles it through vacant slip for four
Phangiso pulls his length back on middle, chopped from the stumps to sweeper cover off the back foot
tossed up, hint of turn around off, Warner smothers it
fired short and outside off, Warner skips back and cracks a cut through the covers, Rabada slides in vain at the edge of the boundary
much better from Phagiso. Lobs this on middle. Keeps Warner to a defence
slides on with the arm on middle, cut through backward point
full and straight on middle from over the wicket, clipped to long-on
Tahir gives this more air outside off, Khawaja pushes it gently to long-off
pushed through at the legs, tapped to long-on
floats a wrong'un, full in length, poked towards point off an edge
Tahir now drops it short and outside off, Khawaja short-arm jabs it past midwicket
full legbreak around off, pushed to the cover region
darted short and outside off, cut through point on the back foot
yikes! Pushed through outside off, shoots low, beating Warner's cut
Warner comes down the track to meet a full one early, whipped down to long-on
shorter and drifts in as Khawaja skips back and clips behind square
turn and bounce! It nibbles in and sticks in the surface. Blocked to the leg side
slid through on off, Khawaja goes back for a cut but is cramped for room. He ends up chopping it onto the pitch
Tahir finds turn and slips one down leg, Warner goes low and helps it away to the fine leg boundary with a nifty sweep
legbreak on middle, Warner hangs back and milks a single through the square leg region
slides on outside off, Khawaja takes it from there and sweeps firmly through square leg, KG runs to his left from deep midwicket, slides, and keeps it to a couple
Tahir pitches this outside off and gets it to turn in, defended off the back foot
another legbreak, on a length, swept through backward square leg
ripping turn from round the wicket! Zips in from outside off, Warner does not cover for the spin. Prods and gets an inside edge onto the pad
Khawaja keeps sweeping from outside off, there are two men behind square. Short fine leg tidies this up
slides on just outside off, punched off the back foot to the covers
Warner skips out and meets a full ball, which is slapped to long-on. Warner keeps ticking. Australia keep ticking
spins in on middle, Khawaja plays back and nudges it towards backward square leg
full and turns on middle, down the track, and quietly pushed back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, stylishly whipped to deep midwicket
short and turns away outside off, cut away to short extra cover, where the fielder (Amla) dives to his right and fumbles
skiddy full ball on middle, chopped to the off side
drifting down leg, sweep and a miss, wide
length ball on off, solidly pushed to cover
Warner uses his feet, JP held this one back on middle, defended
JP drops it short on middle and leg, keeps low. But Warner went low with it and pulled it away past midwicket, beats long-on to his left
nipping down leg, Warner deflects it towards square leg
tossed slow and outside off, sweep and a miss. Replays show that Phangiso hit the front pad outside off
bang! Khawaja charges down the track, meets the pitch of this full ball outside off and launches it over long-off for the third six of the game
shorter and outside off, glanced towards short fine leg
spins in on off, full in length, Warner is forward to smother it
too full on off now, neatly flicked to long-on
goes on straight outside off, Khawaja is on the back foot as he whips to midwicket
short and drifts in on middle, punched down to long-on
short offbreak outside off, jabbed down to long-on
full and straight on off, hits the pad first. Muffled lbw shout. Not given. Interesting... Impact in line. The tracker shows that it would have hit the top of the leg stump.
whirls down a quicker ball on middle, pushed to long-on
full toss on middle, whipped past midwicket
full and turns away slightly outside off, Warner pushes and misses
back of a length and outside off, run down to third man
Warner hops and guides this short ball to point
short and outside off, Warner crunches a cut.. JP dives to his right at backward point and makes a smart stop
tucked off the hips behind square on the leg side
veering down the leg side, Khawaja just helps it on its way for four
banged in short on middle, the batsman hops and defends it back to the bowler
loopier on middle, blocked on the front foot
angled in from round the stumps, tapped to long-off
short on middle, backs away and cuts to backward point
dropped short and that's cut away again. Cover-point (Rabada) dives to his left and makes a half stop
excellent running. Warner just picked it off the pads behind square and set off
full and straight, pushed to off side on the front foot
full and at the pads, twirled down to fine leg
short and width outside off, Warner cracks it. Cuts through point. Phangiso runs to his right from sweeper and hunts it down with a well-timed slide. Warner's timing was better, though
short and angled away outside off, steered to third man
another full leg-stump ball, this is clipped through midwicket
off-stump yorker, squeezed out
tucked off the pads behind square. He charges back for the second
straighter one, nudged wide of midwicket
full on middle and leg, bunted to short midwicket
full and dips on middle, leaves the batsman searching for a flick. He skews it back to the bowler off a leading edge. Rolls down the pitch
width outside off, biffed to Amla at short extra cover
picked away off the pads past short fine leg for two
fired fast and down leg, sweep and a miss, wide called by ump Wilson
drifts in slow on middle, blocked on the front foot
full and angling away outside off from over the wicket, pushed through the covers
full and outside off, hacked to long-on. Misses out on the free-hit
full on middle, defended
too full on middle, pushed to the left of short extra cover to long-off
good length and skating across the left-hander, beaten
full on off, shuffles across and clips to short midwicket
back of a length and angled away outside off, punched to short extra cover
Warner steps out, takes it on the full and drives to long-off
full and shoots low, turns and foils the timing. Skewered to midwicket
pushed down leg, Khawaja sweeps and tickles it fine on the leg side
flighted half-volley outside off, Khawaja unfurls a languid cover drive, nobody sweeping the boundary there
quicker and spins away outside off, chopped to extra cover
looped on the leg stump, defended
full and attacking the stumps, played back to the bowler
short on the hips, short-arm jab to deep midwicket. Warner moves to 99
dug in outside off, Khawaja steps across off and whips to short midwicket, where Amla did not bend enough, letting it slip through his legs
played, Warner. Subdued celebrations. No leap to the moon, there. He kisses the helmet and raises his bat. Short and wide outside off, Warner cuts to sweeper cover and raises his century
cutter drifting down leg, helped to fine leg for two
short and just a shade outside off, time for Khawaja to raise his bat. Punched to mid-off for a half-century. He is embraced by Warner
full and straight, whipped smartly to long leg
short and angled in, defended
back of a length and outside off, chopped to extra cover
short and wide outside off, stops on Warner. He does not bother, swatting it over midwicket
short and angled in on off, tucks him up for room. Blocked
short and wide outside off, flat-batted away. FB dives and makes a half save at short extra cover
tucked from leg stump to midwicket
dug in on the leg stump, pings the top of the front pad as Warner misses the flick. The fast bowler has overstepped by a substantial margin
Warner moves away outside leg, the bowler chases him with a full ball, which is skewed in the air... past extra cover
and Warner backs away again and is followed, this time by a short ball, dabbed to the off side
short and heading down leg, off the thigh to short fine leg
poor ball, put away. Back of a length and down leg, swivel-pulled to fine leg
short and ducks in, poked back to Abbott

gone! What a start this is for SA after the drinks break. A short delivery on middle is pulled powerfully but straight to midwicket. Comfortable height too. Warner was waiting on that back foot and hit it beautifully, just some indecisiveness whether to go over or keep it down. In the end, did neither. But what an innings that was
fullish length on off, Smith doesn't shuffle too much and plays a block to cover
poor delivery. Short on leg, Smith rocks back to pull to deep square leg. Nicely played
overpitched on off, driven to mid-off
superbly bowled. Yorker on off, almost gets through. Khawaja jams it out to point. Good over so far
superb save from Behardien. Parnell applauds, rightly so. Overpitched and driven exquisitely to cover's right, he puts in a lovely dive to stop runs
tossed up on off, pushed to point with the turn.
a rank long-hop and Smith pummels a pull to midwicket. Shot
dances down the track to drill to long-on for a run. Good use of the feet
fantastic from AB this time. Tossed up on off, driven towards long-off but AB saves the run with a dive from cover
punched to cover off the back foot
a touch too short outside off, Smith hurries back to punch to deep cover this time. Another tidy over.
a naughty full toss on middle and clipped to deep square leg. Smith should have put that away

AB drops a clanger. Yes, AB. It's de Villiers. AB. A tossed up googly outside off, Khawaja gets a top-edge which carries to square leg. AB gets around from midwicket, sets up under it, waits for the ball and then drops it. Maybe hit the hard part of his hand
punched to long-off
Smith tries to sweep a full, straight delivery but misses it almost, just gets a thin edge which saved him
Smith runs to the ball and drills a drive to long-on. Another good over. SA racking em up
slowish outside off, Smith opens the bat face very late to guide to short third man. Well played
flat outside off, Khawaja turns the ball towards backward square leg for a run
another dot. Short and wide, Smith cuts but straight to point
more flight and loop on off, Smith defends towards cover. Wants one but doesn't get it
steered to point
leg side-ish on the pads and worked to long-on
googly on off, wristily flicked to long-on
flight outside off, slow. Khawaja lunges forward and leaves!
very flat on middle and leg, nurdled to deep square leg
flat on off, Smith tries to clip to square leg but can't
beautiful bowling. Flight on off, Smith comes down and keeps it out
another dot. Short and wide, mistimed to cover

taken this time! Amla takes it, and Khawaja has to go. Flat on off, Khawaja gets low to sweep and gets another top edge which goes up in the air and is taken at short fine leg. Beautiful bowling, not afraid to give the ball some air even to the left-hander. Australia losing their way
a bit of turn, well bowled. Flat outside off, extracts some purchase and pushed to point
flat outside off. Bailey comes down but pads it back to the bowler
short and wide, scythed to deep point
more flight on middle and leg, defended
pushed to long-on
flat on off, Smith flicks easily to backward square leg for one. Much quicker there
paddle-swept to deep fine leg. Aus' 200 is up
full toss on middle and leg, flicked past midwicket for a couple. Better footwork from SMith, getting close to the pitch
slow and wide outside off, pushed to point
thrashed to deep cover
another paddle sweep attempted. Off the toe-end towards short third man for one instead
shot! Bailey runs to the pitch of the ball, gets there and puts the ball over long-on with a beautiful lofted drive. Once he got to the pitch, it was always going to be a safe shot
clipped to backward square leg
outside edge and that will be four more. Short and wide, width. Smith under-edges to the third man boundary.
too much width again, laced to deep point for one
flat outside off, Bailey hurries back to nudge to square leg
full and straight, Smith defends

given! Bailey is gone. Wrong un' from Tahir on middle, strikes Bailey in front. Bailey reviews. That looks pretty adjacent. It has spun a little into Bailey and he did have a significant stride. his only hope is height I guess. No bat. Umpire's call, just clipping leg stump so Bailey has to go.
another googly to start outside off, kept out
flat on off, defended
shortish and wide, flat. Cut to deep point
another googly outside off, very similar to the Bailey wicket. But slightly outside the line I guess
flat outside off, patted to point. Superb bowling
driven, from outside off, to deep cover
lovely shot. Slightly short, not very. But Smith picks up the length quickly, picks the gap and then pulls to the midwicket boundary. Landed just inside
push and run to AB at cover, who is very quick on it and releases even quicker. De kock takes the bails off but Marsh is back
slowish on middle and leg, kept out
driven to cover again, another dot ball
sees Marsh coming so Phangiso shortens the length outside off, thrashed to deep cover
a flatter delivery on middle, no air. Smashed to long-off
clears the rope. Nicely played. Smith comes to the pitch of the legbreak and then lofts the ball over long-off with ease. hit with the spin, nice straight bat
short and wide, mis-timed into the off side
another flat delivery and straight, blocked
worked into the leg side for a run from a straight line
yorker on leg, worked away to midwicket for a run
swivel-pulled to deep square leg. Marsh struggling for timing
full and wide outside off, tapped towards point for one
low full toss and put into the gap at midwicket for four. Missed his yorker length and Abbott pays the price. More a smear, sill not timed as well as he would like
Marsh's struggling innings ends. Another full toss on off, below the waist. Marsh mis-times his heave to midwicket. Did not get any of it there, straight to Behardien at deep midwicket
drifts down leg, played down to fine leg. Missed his line, but so many wickets means a new man is facing
fullish length outside off, Smith shuffles across but is truck outside the line. The pair scamper a leg bye to third man
smashed for four. Quite full, Smith sees the opportunity and swivel-flicks it to the square leg boundary. Played that nicely, on the bounce
low full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
looking for a mow over midwicket but Wade inside-edges onto his pads and back up the pitch. A scampered run
short and wide, slapped to cover with terrible timing. Just the one, fantastic bowling. Taking pace off that short delivery
fullish on middle and leg, clipped towards wide long-on. A fumble allows the second. Aus bring up 250
good short one to end. But a wide called. Shortish outside off, Wade doesn't interfere. The ball is over head height
smeared to long-on for just one this time
full and wide outside off, Wade went across to ramp over short fine leg but gets an inside edge back to the keeper
shortish on off, smeared to midwicket. Just the one.
overpitched outside off, drilled to mid-off for just one. Australia going nowhere in these last few overs
superb timing. Picked his spot and executed. Fullish outside off, Wade backs away and times a lofted cover drive. Easily over cover and four. good spot in the field
wow, what an effort from du Plessis at long-off. Absolutely smashed, du Plessis got there and stopped it.
smeared to deep square leg for just the run. A splendid effort from Abbott, nine off the last but a very good spell nonetheless
lovely shot. Gets down low and ramps the ball past fine leg. Executed. Used the pace. Landed just inside again
full toss on middle, takes Wade by surprise who smears to square leg, losing his bat in the process. Almost went on to hit the stumps. Hmm. Two though
goes again and he'll get four again. Slightly leg side-ish and Wade gets low and ramps the scoop over the keeper.
smashed but straight to Behardien at mid-off. A direct hit would have had Wade
superb yorker. On middle. Smith backs away and carves a ball to backward point. Right idea, just missed out on four

full and straight, given! Yorker on off, Wade sets up for another scoop and misses it. The ball strikes Wade well outside off though, Umpire Joel Wilson gives him out. Shocking decision, struck him well outside the line
flat-batted to the long-off boundary. Back of a length on off, Smith probably premeditated a shot to that area, considering mid-off was up
overpitched on off, jammed out to cover
fullish on off, just pushed to point to get one. Faulkner wanted to give strike to Smith I presume
shortish on off, pulled in front of deep square leg for a couple. Decent shot but lacking any timing
superb batting again. Gives himself room and lofts the ball over cover, and he gets four. Picking his spots really well. Fifty for Smith, a tad slow but has got the runs
smeared to deep midwicket for a couple. Parnell fumbles the throw from Behardien, could have prevented the extra run
swing right away from over the wicket. Angled in and swerves away outside off, left alone
147ks, left alone outside off again
nudging 140ks. Full and defended
half-volley outside off, no swing, Qdk lines it up and caresses a drive through the covers. Pleasing stroke, easy on the eye
inswinger on the pads, too full again, picked away through square leg. Neatly done from the batsman
back of a length on middle and leg now, defended
full and slants down leg, wide
full and outside off, forward and driven to point
full and angled in on off, Amla covers up in defence
short and width outside off, Amla cuts and finds Khawaja at third man
full and angled away on off, Qdk nudges a single to square leg
shortish on off, Amla keeps back and runs it down to fly slip
full and comes in at off stump, Amla is firmly in line to block
full and angled in on middle, forward and solidly pushed to mid-off
full and skating in at 144.7ks, Qdk is a touch late as he pokes an outside edge to mid-off
too full on off, clipped to mid-on
hurled full, homing in on middle, flicked to mid-on for one
full and fired at off 149.3ks, Amla taps to mid-off
half volley outside off, Amla uses the pace of Starc and plays a wristy drive, which is stopped by Warner at backward point with a dive
full and outside off, Qdk glides it to backward point
Hazlewood bowls it on a back of a length outside off, chopped to the same fielder
short and angled in, rears up at Qdk, who loosens his grip and fends it back to the pitch
back of a length and angled on off, turned behind square on the leg side
back of a length and around off, Amla plays late, dabbing a cut past fly slip to third man
back of a length and angled in, chopped to the left of Wade
fuller and outside off, 144ks, pushed back to the bowler on  the front foot
Starc keeps it full. This is an off-stump yorker, in fact. Kept out
banged in short and wide outside off, too wide. Qdk shaped to cut before bailing out at the last moment
short on off, cramps the batsman for room. Chopped to point for one
full and angling away outside off, Amla slaps it away. Driven on the up over short extra-cover
good length and swerves in, Amla squirts it in front of his feet with an inside edge

short and down leg, 138ks, Amla shapes to pull and tickles it off the <s>thigh</s> glove, beats Wade and runs away.... It bounced up chest-high at the keeper. Smith chases the ball, he was in contact with the ropes while touching the ball and looking to haul it in. Should have been runs
full, angled in, goes away, catches the outside edge and rolls to point
back of a length and angled in, Qdk drops it to backward point and gets off to the other end
inducker cramps the left-hander for room, defended onto the pitch
full and angled in on middle, blocked back to the bowler
reverts to the shorter length outside off, angled towards short third man
full and straight, clipped past the square leg umpire
full and on middle, defended back
too full on middle, punched down the ground. Mid-on dives and deflects the ball to mid-off
overpitched and outside off, Amla drills a drive to mid-off. The fielder effects a direct hit. Qdk had set off but undid his steps in time. Well in time. Finch was the fielder there
sliding into the pads, Amla plays across the line and misses the flick. The ball rolls off the pad towards point
Amla clears his front leg and stabs this off-stump ball to midwicket. Off the inside half of the bat
short and angling across Amla, gives him the width. And Amla happily cuts it away through point
belted across the line for four! Back of a length and angled in around off, Qdk shuffles across and swats it over backward square leg

and the encore fails! Hazlewood gets the breakthrough. Good length and wider outside off. He goes across the line again. Last ball he hit it to the left of the fielder, played it finer. Now he shovels it and holes out to deep square leg. Faulkner completes the catch
full and angled in on off, Faf loosens his grip and defends it back to the bowler
full and angled in on middle and leg, Faf dabs a single in front of mid-on
short and Hazlewood gifts width outside off, Amla tears open the wrapper and slaps it behind point, beats third man to his right. He leans back and nails it!
full and aimed at off, Amla respects it with a quiet defence
back of a length on middle, Faf stands tall and punches to mid-off
shorter on off, Faf presents a high elbow as he solidly punches to short extra cover
short on middle, angled to backward point
too full on off, driven on the front foot to mid-off
length and outside off, sliced past backward point towards third man
back of a length and tails into Amla, he yanks his bottom hand off the bat as he defends it
too full and straight, Faf welcomes Mitch Marsh with a whipped single to deep midwicket
full toss, dips on the leg stump, picked away to deep midwicket
angled into the pads, Faf helps it away to the fine leg boundary
too full on middle, driven down the ground. Crisp.... Mid-on throws himself to his left to stop the ball
full and straight, Amla camps back and guides it behind square
cutter outside off, Faf shows the full face of the bat and drives to short extra cover
full on off, slapped to point
Faf gallops down the track and slaps again. This is sent over the covers even as the ball was angling away from him
short and angling away, Faf plays late and runs it down to third man
full cutter, opens up Amla slightly. He plays across the line, searches for a flick, and rolls a leading edge onto the pitch
Faulkner goes wide of the crease and angles it into Amla, turned to leg
overpitched and outside off, eased to short extra cover
top stroke from Amla. Bisects mid-on and mid-off. Full on off, not a half volley, driven ram-rod straight down the ground
full on the pads, worked to midwicket
short on off, Faf gets on top of the bounce and plays to point
Faf skips out again, meets a length ball and bashes it over mid-on. Faf has been pretty busy this evening. No faffing around
veering into the pads, turned to long leg
short on off, worked behind square with the wrists
full and angled in from round the wicket, straightens off the surface, and beats the edge
full and angled in on off, Amla shuffles back and dabs a single to the left of square leg
fraction full on off, Faf middles the drive and finds extra cover. Placement was missing, though
short on off from wide of the crease, swatted to deep midwicket
Amla slots this full ball to deep cover with a drive
veering into the hips, glanced to deep square leg. Two. Busy running. SA building nicely in this 289 chase
full and angled in on middle, Amla goes back and clips to deep midwicket
dug in short on middle, Faf gets on top of the bounce, rolls his wrists to control a pull to deep midwicket
slightly overpitched and outside off, Amla drives uppishly to short extra cover
veering into the pads, tucked around the corner
dug in short on off, Faf does not get on top of the bounce this time. Flaps a pull to mid-on
full on off, steered to deep cover via an open face
short and outside off, cut on the back foot to sweeper cover
straighter one, pushed to the off side
short again, googly? Faf pulls and gets an under edge onto the pad
short legbreak outside off, slapped to short extra cover
turn and bounce! Legbreak leaves Faf outside off and defeats the cut
flighted and full on off, squeezed back to Zampa
short on off, Amla plays late and steers it to third man
short and wide outside off, Faf has a leaden-footed slash at it and sends a thick outside edge through the vacant cordon
cutter outside off, eased down to long-off
back of a length and outside off, cut to deep cover
leg-stump ball, glanced past short fine leg
shortish on off, angled to short third man where the fielder fumbles
loopy legbreak outside off, driven to long-off
legbreak again, the length is short and is cut away to backward point
cries of "catch it" does not carry to long-on. Whirls down a quicker short ball outside off, Amla drags a pull, Khawaja runs in from long-on, attacks the ball. It drops in front of him
googly, zips into the right-hander, played to the off side for one
fired short on middle, Amla drops back and pulls firmly over midwicket
slider outside off, chopped out to sweeper cover
nice start, tossed up on off, drilled back at him
quite an ugly shot by Amla's standards but what a shot that is. Too much flight, Amla clears his front foot and drills the lofted drive over long-off. Sliced it
short and wide outside off, mis-timed to midwicket
punched to the sweeper cover off the back foot
flight on off, too full. Faf lunges forward and drives to long-off
the flat, quick, slider/darter. Amla picks it and drives to long-on with ease
more flight on off but the length is good, Amla taps to point. Just short enough to command  respect
overpitched outside off and muscled to deep cover
too full, straight. Driven to long-off, these two doing it easy
nice. Splendid spot. Some flight on the legbreaj on off, Amla opens up his stance and hits over cover with a straight bat.
flat on off, pushed to long-off
slower and wider outside off, hit to cover. Not a bad over at all but still seven riskless runs
flight outside off and pushed to long-off
well bowled, slower on middle and turned to fine leg. good length
way too full and easily driven to long-off. An easy fifty for Amla, has made things look so classy
slowed up through the air and bunted to long-off with a languid drive
short, slow and wide, Chopped to cover
a shake of the head from Amla as he picks out cover off a half-volley outside off
shortish and wide, slapped past cover for a brace. Great batting this
short and wide, a loose offering and laced to deep point. SA eating away at this target
pummeled for four. A full toss from Zampa on middle, smashed past the bowler. Races away for four to long-on
adjusts his length by tossing it up on middle, a solid block ensues
the slider on off, Amla rocks back and cuts to deep point
beautiful drift, slides it towards leg and gets some purchase towards middle. Faf blocks
superb yorker outside off, Amla opens the face of his bat to guide to third man
overpitched on off and driven back to the bowler
excellent bowling. Looking for that yorker again, just misses as a low full toss is jammed out to cover
full on middle and blocked comfortably. these two intent on playing Starc out which is the right strategy
full and wide, inviting the drive. Faf obliges but finds cover

oh yes. What a shot. So many of those shots in Zimbabwe against Australia are similar to this one. Full on middle, Faf presents the straight bat and lofts the ball right over the umpire. Four to long-off. Shot of the day?
poor line. Drifts on leg and clipped to fine leg. Smith trying to get through his fifth bowler
a good length outside off, Faf bunts to cover. through the shot slightly too early
nice lines. Closer to off, played away towards cover
punched to the sweeper cover off the front foot
full and straight, worked to midwicket. Better line to Amla
124 kph, slower ball outside off, may have stopped in the surface just a tad. Bunted to deep cover. Amla through the shot way too early
ooh, full and wide, some late away shape. Amla drives but doesn't connect. That wide slip would have been interested
yorker on leg, jammed out towards midwicket. Good run, both respond positively and the run is easy
nicely played. Reached out for the drive but drove it past cover for a brace.
another yorker on off, played back to Starc who feigns a throw
a high full toss outside off, outside-edged to third man and Faf has fifty on his return to cricket from a  finger injury
well played. A full length delivery outside off is pushed to backward point. No reason to play an exuberant stroke
full and straight, Faf pats to point, looking for one but Amla doesn't want it
driven to the sweeper cover from the crease
slower ball on middle, played towards short midwicket for a quick single. 100 partnership for these two
keeps it full and straight again, on middle. Steered to point
driven to long-off easily
pushed to mid-off to end a tidy over from Marsh
smashed off the back foot to deep cover. Too much width from Hazlewood
full and wide, intentionally bowled. Faf leaves
driven to long-off. Too full that time. Faf in great touch

got im. Amla goes. He has picked out cover to perfection. Overpitched again outside off from Hazlewood, Amla leans on the drive and smashes it straight to Smith at cover who leans forward and takes the catch a few inches off the ground
oohs from the fielders. A good length delivery, darting back in and AB chops one to the keeper, just evades the stumps
clipped towards midwicket to get off the mark
slower outside off, driven to deep cover
flight and drift to leg, pushed to midwicket
short and wide from Zampa, scythed to deep point and Faf rushes back for the second easily
slower on off, short. Nice length. Driven to deep cover. Good control over his variations
short on off, smashed to the square leg boundary. Got down early. His first boundary this series, after 91 balls.
flight outside off, AB shuffles across to sweep but misses. Struck on the body
jags back in again towards off. Faf was looking to drive through the off side but chopped it to the keeper
and again. Just coming back enough to ensure Faf cannot drive through the off side. Jammed back towards the stumps
full and wide outside off, slapped to point
shortish length outside off, punched to long-off
smeared to midwicket. Again, de Villiers was looking to go straight but the inward movement took it off towards square leg
oh yes. Suddenly, a flurry of boundaries for AB. The place he wanted to go off the previous delivery. Full on middle, a splendid on-drive hurtles to the long-on boundary
flight on off, pushed to cover
shortish and wide, smashed to deep cover. Varying his pace quite well here Zampa
more flight on middle, Ab drives, with the spin, to long-off. Played that well. Good battle
pushed in the same gap, to long-off
slightly short and AB rocks back to cut to deep point
nice end. Slow on leg, Faf clears his leg slightly and defends. Doesn't want the slider to hit the pad
advances and smeared to the midwicket boundary. One of AB's most un-pleasing boundaries. Runs to the pitch, looking to go straight, but the inswing helps skew the stroke off the inside half
full and straight, played to midwicket
my word. What ease. Short and wide outside off, AB stands tall and swats the ball over midwicket. Never in any fear or hesitation. Smashed for six.
overpitched on off, driven to long-on
edged for four this time. Fullish line outside off, AB plays the line but the ball moves away ever so slightly and takes the outside edge. No slip in place
a mis-timed drive to mid-off
patted to point. Some miscommunication as AB comes halfway down before he is sent back. All's well that ends well
uppish but safe. Pace off the ball again, 120 kph. Faf finds a gap at cover to get one
glided off the open face to point for one
Faulkner from over the wicket, bowls a full and straight delivery. Driven to long-off
another slower delivery on middle, pushed back to the bowler
128 kph slower ball to finish and worked to midwicket

and he gets the wicket straightaway. Big, big wicket. Full and wide outside off, Faf reaches out for it and can't control the drive. It's in the air and taken at backward point. Huge wicket. Just got a hint of away movement there on that, which was responsible for Faf struggling to control the ball
fullish, tailing back in late from outside off. Duminy inside-edges into his body
a full toss outside off, kept out
ooh, full again, swerving back in. Duminy drives but gets a thick inside edge to fine leg for one
yorker outside off, jammed out again
quite full on middle, driven to mid-on
fullish and wide, slapped to deep cover
tight lines around off, blocked back with a punchy drive
worked away to deep square leg
just got enough to clear mid-off. Full and wide, JP went after it and got just enough on his drive to clear the fielder. Good intent though
guided to third man for one
too full on middle and leg, and pushed to long-on
full and angled in from wide of the crease, AB square drives and ends up slicing it to deep point. Smith at slip could come into play
full and ducks back in, Duminy squirts it to fine leg off an inside edge
full inswinger, bunted down to mid-on. Hazlewood is hanging back there. AB is quick anyway
full and straight, 146ks, jabbed back to the bowler
full and snakes in outside off, Duminy aims to drive it rather square. He has to settle with another inside edge. Starc is working to shoot through that gate
back of a length and swings in, blocked to the leg side
picked away off the pads to deep midwicket
shortish and on off, punched back at the bowler
dug in short and outside off, Duminy drags it from there and miscues it in the air. Does to carry to a diving Finch at mid-on. Just drops short. Duminy is shaky
fraction short and outside off, bottom-handed shovel to long-on
another inside edge. Duminy has a hard heave at this incoming ball and squirts an inside edge onto the front pad
too full on middle, bunted to long-off
low full toss outside off, gives Duminy the release. He eases forward and drives it through point for four
that should give Duminy more confidence. Pretty full on middle, Duminy lifts it with authority over mid-on. Nice high-elbow pose for the cameras
hurled in full on middle, defended back
inswinging full toss on middle, pushed calmly to long-on
full ball, angled in from wide of the crease and bends away. Messes up with AB's drive and induces an outside edge that rolls behind point to third man
overpitched and outside off, Duminy leans forward. Good weight transfer easing a drive to short extra cover, who dives, takes some pace off the ball
short and wide outside off, AB laces a cut to deep point
full and angled in, turned to short midwicket
short and width outside off, late cut to backward point, straight to the fielder
cutter straightens just outside off, dab and miss. JP played early and didn't touch it
good length and angled in on the off stump, whipped to short midwicket
back of a length, outside off, chopped to short third man
full and straight, clipped through backward square leg for one
Duminy steps down the track, the bowler shortens his length outside off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
pitched up on off, milked down to long-on
full on leg stump, JP pre-meditates a sweep and tickles it to short fine leg

massive blow! AB is bowled. Good length and (reverse)swings back in, AB swings and Hazlewood rides his car through the gate and parks it on top of the middle stump. Then he roars like this. Mid-off was up and AB was targetting to pump it over that man
wicket-to-wicket line, pushed down the ground
full and on off, chopped towards backward point
full on off, swings in, FB plays a wafty drive to midwicket

Backward point dives and shells a chance Short and wide outside off, JP lashes a cut in the air. Warner throws himself to his left, attempts the catch with both hands, despite a taped-up thumb, it does not stick. Warner leaves the field. Maxi is on as sub
fuller and angled in around off, JP cuts again. Ends up chopping an inside edge to Wade
short and angled in from wide of the crease, punched to short midwicket
veering into the hips, tucked squarer of short fine leg
floated full and outside off, Duminy strides forward and drives to the covers
shorter and just a shade outside off, chopped to third man
full and angled in on middle and leg, flicked to short midwicket
back of a length and angled in, blocked to short midwicket
full and aimed at off, pushed for a quick single in front of mid-on. A direct hit from Zampa could have put FB in trouble
JP comes down the track and gets a short ball that is lifted over Hazlewood's head
drops it short and outside off, swatted to deep midwicket
slog swept from outside off to deep midwicket

FB has been given out lbw by umpire Llong. FB wants a review after consulting with his senior partner. Impact: pad first. This just skids off the deck in line with middle and raps the front pad before FB managed a tickle, pressing forward. The tracker shows that it would have gone onto hit the leg stump. Umpire Llong's decision is vindicated. SA falling away
looped up on middle, he bends forward in defence
legbreak on middle, shorter in length, played back to the bowler
pushed down the ground for one
full angled in and straightens a shade outside off, Parnell feels for it and misses
awayswinger full and outside off, Parnell throws his hands at it and slices an outside edge to third man
fraction short and outside off, JP crunches a pull over midwicket. He is now the key for SA
full and wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover
overpitched on off, driven to mid-off
short and angled in on middle, blocked
Duminy steps out and manufactures a very full ball, which is jabbed to long-on
Dropped, burst through the fingers of Faulkner.Wrong'un leaves the left-hander. He slashes an outside edge in the air. Through the hands of Faulkner at backward point
slides on full and outside off, JP goes with the spin and slog sweeps a six into the stands beyond midwicket

Zampa dangles another wrong'un and takes down Duminy. Floated on middle, he goes for the slog sweep again, this time holing out to deep midwicket. Duminy goes and with it SA's hopes? Maxi, the sub, completed the waist-high catch
looks another googly, chopped to sweeper cover
whipped to midwicket as this skids off the surface on middle
angled in, yorker, tails away late, past the outside edge
the off stump is sent cartwheeling. Nails it full and finds some awayswing. Enough to beat the outside edge of this lazy poke and take out the off stump. Abbott was left squared up
full and angled in from wide of the crease, shapes away late, angled bat defence
another outswinger, draws the tail-ender forward and beats the outside edge
full and outside off, beaten again. This was not far from off stump. Starc knows it and has his hands on his head
full and angled in on off, clipped gingerly to mid-on. Phangiso denies Starc a maiden
short on middle, chopped to short third man
chopped past cover now as this was short again
tossed on leg, Parnell steps out and has an almighty swing at it, only to toe-end a catch to long-on. Marsh completes a shoulder-high catch. Zampa has his third wicket
drifts in on the leg stump, takes the pad. Looked like it pitched outside leg
googly, sliding into the leg stump, awkwardly kept out
lobs this up on off, the batsman drags an inside edge through square leg

Maxi takes a screamer at backward point. Plucks it out of thin air. Angled in full and tails away late outside off at 146ks to mess with the drive. He slices it in the air. Maxi leaps and stretches his right hand over his head. He comes out with the ball in one hand. One-handed stunner! The timing of the jump was impressive
Tahir backs away a bit, full on off, kept out
width outside off, cut to third man
full and tails back in late, zips past the inside edge

big appeal for lbw, not given by Wilson. Steven Smith challenges the on-field call. Inswinging full toss, raps the back pad in front of leg stump. All three stumps visible. Looked like it was sliding down the leg side. The tracker confirms it
full and angled in, Tahir covers up and secures a single to extra cover
flighted on off, the batsman goes low and sweep-scoops to fine leg
shorter and outside off, rocks back and pulls to long-on
Wade misses a stumping. Full and dips just outside off as Tahir swings and misses. Wade snatches at the first attempt, juggles, and is late as the batsman slides back
chopped to short third man
shorter and slapped down the ground
dangled up on the leg stump, sweeps and misses, rolls off the pad towards short fine leg
full and drifting into the pads, glanced to fine leg
short and shading towards the leg stump, takes the pad and wanders to square leg
back of a length and outside off, Tahir cuts to sweeper cover

Australia win! back of a length and angled in, helped down to deep fine leg. They aim for the second. There is a direct hit at the non-striker's end from wicketkeeper Wade after collecting the throw from Khawaja in the deep. Redemption for the missed stumping? Tahir's bat is in the air as the bails get dislodged. All over
